subject: Entrepreneurship
title: Why Founders Get Fired From Their Own Companies
description: A short lesson to help you apply Why Founders Get Fired From Their Own Companies.

hook.text: Steve Jobs, Travis Kalanick, Jack Dorsey, Andrew Masonâ€”all fired from companies they created.

buildup.text: The skills that start a companyâ€”risk-taking, aggression, visionâ€”aren't always the skills to run one.

discovery.text: Boards replace founders when the company outgrows the founder's management ability.

twist.text: Some founders thrive as CEOs forever (Bezos, Zuckerberg). The difference is often self-awareness.

climax.text: Smart founders evolve. They hire people better than themselves and learn to let go of control.

punchline.text: Building a company and running one are two different jobs.

quiz.question: Why are some founders removed from their own companies?
options: The skills needed to start a company differ from those needed to scale and manage it
Founders always lose interest after the early stages
Investors legally require founder replacement after Series B
